Generation III.Ruby: Chinchou lets loose positive and negative electrical charges from its two antennas to make its prey faint. This Pok é mon flashes its electric lights to exchange signals with others.
Generation III.Sapphire: Chinchou 's two antennas are filled with cells that generate strong electricity. This Pok é mon 's cells create so much electrical power, it even makes itself tingle slightly.

Generation VII.Sun: Its two antennae were originally fins. It discharges electricity to stun its prey before attacking.
Generation VII.Moon: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its two antennae glow softly to lure in prey, making it a useful Pokémon for night fishing.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Chinchou blink their shining antennae at one another to claim their respective turf.
